review: one of the greatest games ever made in my opinion i got it when i was about 10 years on for snes and it was called out of this world it has story atmosphere excitement terror friendship and much more there really is nothing like it it took me about 90 mins to beat it again but its still cinematic in the presentation and whats happening i couldnt recommend it more this is a masterpiece for all time

this brings back memories my first time playing this in the 90s i was hooked what an amazing game a real before and after for gaming  felt the same way over 30 years later i remembered a lot but not everything and solve the puzzles again has been a lot of fun  the improvements in sound quality and graphics are just right its amazing how used we are to current technology and we seem to forget how basic graphics used to be  thanks for the update it was totally worth it

highly recommended a timeless classic game from the good old times no loot boxes no dlc no season pass no payable cosmetics no woke or right wing agenda no shareholder influence etc with updated graphics

a short yet thrilling action adventure in a stunning lowfi science fiction setting some really fantastic sequences the gladiator arena may be an all time video game moment for me great stuff in there try to push through the difficulty curve the controls show their age but a very chill play experience once thats embraced glad i finally returned and played through this gem
fun at first but then the puzzles wear on you

great game in many ways and outshines modern games in many others sadly given the clunky controls and horrible checkpoint locations it can be an utter nightmare to complete i gave up half way through and just watched someone else beat it to save time after seeing the latter half of the game im glad i bailed i played on the steam controller so maybe i would have faired better on a desktop with mouse and kb you want true difficulty unlike synthetic dark souls difficulty play this

another world is the brain child of one eric chahi who did pretty much everything except the music and broke new grounds using vector graphics and non broken visual only narrative   it was really ahead of its time in many level and thanks to this remaster it aged even better this game was a huge success and led chahi to work with infogrames for his next project and then he left the industry for almost 20 years why does this sound so familiar

this is how anniversary editions should be done  id only recommend this to old farts who played it back in the day its a nice nostalgia trip and the remastered visuals and audio dont stray too far from the original art its super easy to switch between the original and remastered assets  while the kids have a liking for pixel art i really dont think the barebones gameplay will be appealing for people who dont have memories tied to the og release
amazing this came to steam

another world is a classic and delivers a punishing yet rewarding experience its short duration packs an intense and memorable journey that continues to resonate with gamers the simple but still challenging gameplay ahead of its time adds to the games enduring appeal decades later game remains relevant proving its influence on modern gaming a mustplay for those seeking a short but impactful journey through a classic and iconic world
still holds up to todays standards  an amazing retro adventure will captivating animations  step back in time and play one of the greats

one of the best adventure game of the 90s it has inspired many games in the genre highly recommended

another world first came out in the 90s on the snes under the name out of this world it is a challenging 2d platformer as most of the games back in the day were it featured a unique story and game play its probably not for everyone and will attract the hardcore fans of the 90s games the game is beatable under 3 hours with all achievements

had this game on the snes and found out its a pretty short game so i figured id beat it for once i got filtered by the caves as a kid pretty much a h g wells equivalent of a science fiction video game you get pranked into another dimension by mother nature then have to work with an otherworldly bro to escape a prison where everything is hunting you down including monsters and the environment trial and error with many checkpoints until you win comfy on steam deck
one of the best games ever a timeless classic

another world tambin conocido como out of this world es un pionero de los plataformeros cinemticos juegos con fsicas relativamente realistas y un buen balance de puzzles combates y plataformeo est bueno pero es corto y tiene una cuota de ensayo y error algo tediosa su sucesor espiritual flashback quest for identity est mucho ms pulido en ese sentido

wonderful game  firstly some gamers may be put off by the discovery aspect of this game and repetitive play aspect of the scenes but if you take for granted you will die and repeat some scenes its a really great game i first played this when i was 1214 years old and completed it in one weekend with no guides no internet and no help lines fortunately these days you can refer to a guide should you happen to get stuck  very atmospheric and like playing a piece of art with its art style
when i was 12 it was my favorite game now it still scores very high in my rankings
dying is part of the fun no seriously it is  one of the best platform puzzle games youll ever play and still as good as it was 31 years ago taken me that long to finish it
definitely a challenge but worth checking out
as amazing as the day it was released

a great fun game from the childhood memories given a second life strongly recommended for 90s kids looking for nostalgia the new graphics looks beautiful like a piece of art you have the option to play it in the original graphics as well   the gameplay is trialerror so it may not be for everyones liking when we were kids my brother and i would spend hours to figure out the games puzzles without the countless online walkthroughs that we have nowadays
was  a great game shame on not providing a 64 bit version it does not work on any recent osx versions anymore

h1positivesh1  great classic arcadey feel   remastered graphics provide a good face lift compared to the pixelated original   sound design is simple but effective retro and remastered   story is told well without any dialogue   h1negativesh1  slippery movement   finicky jump distance   frustrating controls   h1summaryh1  base game completed  yes  dlc completed  na  rating  6  10  above average

a quaint short experience another world is a wordless journey of survival where frequent checkpoints assist the games brutal difficulty although the game expects you to need to brute force some of its puzzles many are solvable on the first try if you are paying close attention the game is only 2 hours long so it may not be worth full price but it is definitely worth playing

pretty buggy in 2022  it greeted me with a black screen so first i have to fumble around in the settings file as it seems it doesnt want to run fullscreen on 4k the cursor keeps disappearing the controller button layout doesnt really seem to make sense didnt really have a chance to actually play it this way
great game though cannot forget how triggered it used to make me when i was dying constantly as a 90s kid it was pretty cathartic when i completed it here

played this game in 1993 for msdos and was the first time a video game took me really to another planet after 30 years i finally played it again and the experience was again fantastic what a masterpiece i can recommend this to any true gamer out there

i played this back when it came out it was a masterpiece then albeit with some wonky controls i was afraid that it wasnt going to be the same when i bought it again years later it has held up as a masterpiece and the controls are still wonky i really cant think of a game to compare it to its a simple concept of a guy on an alien world trying to survive but its really an excellent experience
